definition: to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)

sentences.english: There is therefore no being that is thereby determined.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人的存在无法在现在就被盖棺论定。

sentences.english: Desiring to be teachers of the law; understanding neither what they say, nor whereof they affirm.
sentences.chinese: 想要作教法师，却不明白自己所讲说的，所论定的。

sentences.english: Modern people argue that Ci originated from Yanyue (Yan music) during Sui and Tang dynasties from the viewpoint of music.
sentences.chinese: 今人多从音乐角度论定词源于隋唐燕乐。

sentences.english: It is too early to conclude this matter.
sentences.chinese: 现在对这事盖棺论定为时过早。

definition: don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
don't pass judgment on a person's life until the lid is on the coffin (idiom)
(of a body of people) to offer all kinds of different opinions (idiom)/to argue endlessly
to study/to examine/to probe/to study the underlying principles
